text: 750 ml bottle to snifter (thanks Ferris). Looks good; a very cloudy apricot with fluffy eggshell head. Smells good too: tart, funky, and mildly lactic with LOADS of Amarillo in the backbone. Tastes like it smells with some salt and a fairly lively, juice-like medium-bodied mouthfeel. Tasty!
Pours a hazy golden orange with no head. Aroma of citrus, sour wheat, oak and funk. Taste follows, very sour vinegar, oak wheat and funk.

Bottle. Muddy peach fuzz hue with very little head. Aroma is pure Amarillo: lemon peel, hay, fresh cut grass. Flavor has more gose tartness and salinity, with fruity Amarillo-based pineapple, sunflower, grass and pear laced in. Acidity is huge, taking the enamel off my teeth. Very little carbonation; medium body. Nice use of Amarillo, but the sourness is a little overbearing.

The beer is a yellowish tan color. Clouded over entirely. Medium white head, fairly fizzy. Little to no lacing. The aroma is oranges, lemons, pineapple, mango on top of a laco sourness. Maybe a touch of spice lurking in the background. Big, juicy citrus sourness. I think theres some coriander. Mild salty tang. Very good balance of sweet fruity flavors and lactic acidity. Its refreshing and easy to drink. Medium body with a decent pucker at the finish. Lingering citrus flavor. Very enjoyable.

Bottle thanks to Dan. Pours a hazy gold orange with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is pepper, funk, salt. Thin mouth, very tart, salt, tropical fruit, herbal, light acidity, very nice.

Bottle thanks to Aaron at the Dangerous Bottle Share #12! Pours a murky, ugly, milky grey-yellow. Almost sand-ish.. Aroma is tart and juicy. Hoppy, lots of coriander, lemon, lemon peel, salty, lactic yoghurt. Taste is tart and salty, light, crisp and tasty. Same spices here as well. Nice, but didnt live up to the aroma, which is almost like grape soda! High carbonation and a light and crisp body.

Bottle thanks to Daawi the man! Pours milky hazy juicy orange. Aromas of yoghurt, lactic sourness, coriander, pineapple, orange, tart citric notes. Taste is lactic, orange, citrus, coriander, grassy notes, grape soda.
Bottle. Golden pour with white head. Nice grassy, herbal and citrus hops with funky fruit aromas.
Bottle. Pours yellow white head. Nose/taste of sea salt, lemon, sour funk, green onion and grass - medium body.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottle Share (pure imperial stout version). As always thanks to Aaron! Milky light yellow pour with tiny lacings. Nose has yoghurt, melon and some lactic notes. Taste has yoghurt, melon, papaya, lactic, light acid and some floral notes.

750ml bottle pours cloudy pale yellow with finger of fizzy head. Nose is tart piney lemon, citrus, tropical candy.Taste is medium high acidity, prominent salty minerality with some sweet lacto lemon fruit candy, tripical citrus and some piney orange. Finishes sour, high acidity, lacto citrus juice, salinity, lemon, pineapple. The acidity level is a little bit prickly, but overall pretty delicious.

Poured from a bottle. Aroma has a light acidity with some medium light citrus notes. Quite a bit of pineapple with some mango and peach. Very fruity with some light, pale malt notes. Pours a hazy, pale golden straw with a medium high, fairly thick, white head that slowly recedes to the edges then lingers as a thin film. Low lacing and small legs. Flavor is somewhat sweet with a balanced acidity as well. Lots of pineapple with lighter grapefruit, orange and mango notes. Faint peach and stone fruit with low bitterness. Low malt notes. Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium high carbonation. Low astringnecy and low alcohol warmth. Overall, a yummy beer with a lot of hop flavor and aroma. Very fruity with nice malt notes and balanced acidity. I love these dry hopped goses from de Garde.

Bottle from a trade with Aaron. Pours unclear milky orange/yellow with no head. Aroma has lots of citrus fruits, tropical hops, lactic tartness, weak sea salt, pear, apple cider, weak spicy and herbal. Also som funk. The taste is fruity, salty and fresh. Notes of green apples, citrusy hops, lactic tartness, vinegar, minerals and grapefruit soda. Nice one!

(750ml bottle) cloudy medium gold, fine white bubbles. Nose of huge amarillo, stonefruit, juicy citrus, lots of dry hops and sour flavors. Taste of amarillo, citrus pulp, medium carb, fresh and sour, lightly salty.

Bottle with thanks to p1meatloaf! Pours cloudy golden orange, small white head, good lacing. Aroma is citrus, pine, wheat, coriander, lemon. Flavor is medium plus tart, fruity, salt on the lips on the finish. Light bdy. Solid, but a step below the others.

Bottle 750ml.
Pours hazy whitish blond with low-medium white head. Aroma is of spices, tea, herbs, leaves. Taste is of citrus, fruits, acid, leaves. Palate: Light body. Medium carbonation. Overall: A tad too acid for the stomach. Pretty nice beer.

Bottle (750 ml). From kcherney, thanks! Split with the Québec crew.

Appearance: Cloudy yellow with a small white head, surprisingly good retention for the style and little lacing. 

Aroma: Less intense and way more balanced than the Citra version we had just before. Its still quite citric and zesty, but theres a pleasant grassy presence, mild oak features and light spiciness. 

Taste: Also citric, zesty and quite tart with grassy presence, oak, mild salty notes and hints of coriander. 

Palate: Light body (feels a bit lighter than the Citra version). Medium carbonation. Rather dry. Citric, coriander and mild saltiness in the finish. 

Overall: The best from the Hose series so far. Its quite citric and zesty, but it remains super drinkable and enjoyable. One of the good De Garde so far. Tasty stuff.

Pours a cloudy yellow with a thin white head that leaves some/low lacing. Nose is of acid fruits, a little gastric acid and grass. Taste is citrusy and indeed really tart, not quite bracingly so but really pushing my limit. Still, really refreshing because of that so its all OK. Body is light, carbonation moderate. Overall a simple but good gose, I think I preferred the Citra version though.

pours milky yellow-grey with a small white cap, reviving and leaving some lacing. salty citrus and peaches, pineapple, light-medium acidity - lactic, citric and acetic; winey oakiness, surprisingly almost doughy maltiness, clean and sharp lemons. light carbonation, light body, tart, winey and spicy-grassy finish. pretty solid like its citra sister.

UPDATED: JUN 1, 2015 bottle from Shads de garde tasting, boom laser show. Amazing indeed. 


Aroma was much stronger tartness and wine than the other in the hose series. Tons of grain, tart, and wine flavors. Berries, vanilla, spices, etc.

Great in your face flavor explosion with perfect balance. Im a huge fan.
Bottle..Pour is yellow with a hazy white head..Nose is funk, nice amarillo hop, grassy, funk, herbs, spice, hay...Taste is nice amarillo, spice, lemon, funk, some grass, fruits...

Hazy golden-straw body, thin white head and light lacing. Salty lemonade, a twist of grapefruit juice, mellow oak, and some orange zest. Medium to light bodied, moderate bitterness, lively acidity and a soft salinity.

Bottle courtesy of Alan at Bills. Pours a beautiful hazy cloudy peach body with thin white lacing. Mouthfeel is soft and refreshing with notes of bright effervescent salty character, tart fruits, sour lemon and dry funky hop. Awesome.
Bottle shared by Al, pours hazy golden color. Notes of salt, peach skin, and tons of juicy bitter grapefruit. medium Bodied. Finish is nice puckery and sour fruit dominant. Very nice
Draft - Lots of lemon rind. Dirty yellow with a small white head. Bright grapefruit pee and tartness, but I dont get any of the saltiness of a Gose. Still very nice though.
